Identification_Area.title: The Touch-and-Go Camera Suite (TAGCAMS) aboard the OSIRIS-REx spacecraft

Modification_Detail.description: Updated schema version. Adding missing "investigation" references. Adding missing "agency" references. Description updated.

External_Reference.reference_text: B.J. Bos, M.A. Ravine, M. Caplinger, J.A. Schaffner, J.V. Ladewig, R.D. Olds, C.D. Norman, D. Huish, M. Hughes, S.K. Anderson, D.A. Lorenz, A. May, C.D. Jackman, D. Nelson, M. Moreau, D. Kubitschek, K. Getzandanner, K.E. Gordon, A. Eberhardt, and D.S. Lauretta, Touch And Go Camera System (TAGCAMS) for the OSIRIS-REx Asteroid Sample Return Mission, Space Science Reviews, 2018, submitted.

Instrument.name: TAGCAMS
Instrument.description: The Touch-and-Go Camera System (TAGCAMS) is part of the guidance, navigation, and control system on OSIRIS-REx, and provides imaging to aid in navigation to and around Bennu, to aid in sample acquisition, and to confirm sample stowage. TAGCAMS consists of two redundant Navigation Cameras, or “NavCams,” and the single “StowCam.”
